means: 报复，反击( retaliate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Instead of retaliating, he walks away leaving his team-mates to fight it out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没有以牙还牙，而是径直走开，让队友去争出个结果。

sentence.Network_en: The administration will begin retaliating in six weeks if EC policies remain unchanged.
sentence.Network_cn: 凯特先生说,如果欧共体一意孤行,美国政府将于六周后开始报复.

字典中复字的解释 ... (7) 回答[ reply] (9) 报复[ retaliate] (13) 免除[赋税徭役][ remit].
打字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 积极性受到了打击〖 knock〗 打击报复〖 retaliate;takerevenge〗 打击乐器〖 percussioninstrument〗.
surplus 顺差tariff for retaliation 报复关税tariff 关税

entry.def: If you retaliate when someone harms or annoys you, you do something which harms or annoys them in return.

example.ex: I was sorely tempted to retaliate...
Christie retaliated by sending his friend a long letter detailing Carl's utter incompetence...
example.tran: 为了报复，克里斯蒂给他朋友寄了一封长信，细述卡尔完全不称职。

auth_sentence.content: But she approves his claim to have been merely retaliating.

auth_sentence.content: Authority for retaliating some of the indignities.

auth_sentence.content: But he commended Seoul for its restraint, and Pyongyang for not retaliating.
auth_sentence.res_content: But he commended Seoul for its restraint, and Pyongyang for not retaliating.
